newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: NatConsolidated sees 1st half profit fall.
newsitem.headline: NatConsolidated sees 1st half profit fall.

text.p: Engineering group National Consolidated Ltd, which specialises in the automotive and housing sectors, said on Friday that net profit in the calendar 1997 first half was expected to fall but it was more confident about the outlook for the full year.

"Whilst the underlying performance of the business has been disappointing in the first quarter, it is expected that the trading profit for the first half should be comparable with last year, but net profit after tax is expected to be lower because of higher interest and tax charges," managing director Doug Curlewis said at the annual meeting.
